description: Building D1, designed by Architecture 00 forms one of two buildings that house Bureau, which offers coworking in the heart of Design District. D1 is home to a variety of workspaces and businesses with meeting rooms, studios and Forum.

events.name: Drop in
events.notes: Lynton Pepper from Architecture 00 will be available to show the building and answer questions.

events.name: Drop in
events.notes: Lynton Pepper from Architecture 00 will be available to show the building and answer questions.

factsheet.heading: Rooftop Basketball Court at C1
paragraphs: An open and welcoming building, intent on fostering community. A rooftop basketball court crowns three storeys of studio space, all accessible via open-air staircases doubling as communal spaces.

factsheet.heading: A creative members club: Bureau
paragraphs: Bureau brings creative people together. This is a new approach to workspace â€” prioritising not just room to think and do, but shared resources, strong networks and space to collaborate.

travel_info:
Additional travel info: The closest tube station in North Greenwich (30 metres). On the 24-hour Jubilee line, it gets you to London Bridge in 8 minutes and Waterloo in 11 minutes.

EMIRATES AIR LINE CABLE CAR
Connecting the Design District to the Royal Docks (near ExCel London) and the DLR.

North Greenwich bus station is a major hub providing direct links across the city.

name: D1 & C1: Bureau at Design District
